{{disambig-two|the Númenórean nobleman|[[Qenya]] name of Ingil in the early legendarium|[[Ingil#Other names|Isilmo]]}} {{infobox character | people=[[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] | name=Isilmo | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Númenor]] | affiliation= | language=[[Adûnaic]], [[Sindarin]] and [[Quenya]] | birth=Between {{SA|1320|n}} and {{SA|1474}}{{UT|Kings}}, entry X ''Tar-Telperien'' | birthlocation= | rule= | death=Between {{SA|1474|n}} and {{SA|1731}} | deathlocation= | age=<411 | notablefor= | house=[[House of Elros]] | parentage=[[Tar-Súrion]] | siblings=[[Tar-Telperiën]] | spouse= | children=[[Tar-Minastir]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Isilmo''' was the younger brother of [[Ruling Queen of Númenor|Queen]] [[Tar-Telperiën]]. He had a son named [[Minastir]]. Tar-Telperiën outlived Isilmo, but she refused to wed and had no children. Thus, Tar-Telperiën was succeeded by Isilmo's son, her nephew, who became [[Tar-Minastir]]. ==Etymology== ''Isilmo'' is a [[Quenya]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but Paul Strack suggests it is a compound of ''[[Moon#Other names|Isil]]'' ("moon") and the agental suffix ''[[-mo]]'' ("one", "anyone", "someone", "somebody").{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=http://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-260443183.html|articlename=Q.
